results.definition: fruit preserved by cooking with sugar
keep in safety and protect from harm, decay, loss, or destruction
examples: children must be taught to conserve our national heritage
The museum curator conserved the ancient manuscripts
conserve your energy for the ascent to the summit

results.definition: keep constant through physical or chemical reactions or evolutionary change
examples: Energy is conserved in this process
Mom always conserved the strawberries we grew in the backyard
